thread.title: Gilberry doesn't practice, while Jones returns for Bengals
thread.title_full: Gilberry doesn't practice, while Jones returns for Bengals

title: Gilberry doesn't practice, while Jones returns for Bengals
text:
Gilberry doesn't practice, while Jones returns for Bengals 
Updated: Thu, Oct 08 2015, 03:24 PM 
CINCINNATI (Richard Skinner) -- Bengals defensive lineman Wallace Gilberry didn't participate in practice for the second straight day on Thursday due to a calf injury, while cornerback Adam Jones did participate after not practicing on Wednesday due to a groin injury. 
The Bengals (4-0) face the Seattle Seahawks (2-2) this Sunday at 1 p.m. in Paul Brown Stadium. 
Gilberry did take part in pre-practice stretching and warm-up and then was seen riding a stationary bike during the 30 minutes practice is open to the media. 
Jones was a limited participant in Thursday's practice. He missed almost the entire second half of last Sunday's win over Kansas City due to the groin injury. 
Offensive tackle Andrew Whitworth was also back at practice after being given a veteran's day off on Wednesday, and cornerback Leon Hall was also a full participant after being limited on Wednesday as he was given part of the day off. 
Safety Reggie Nelson was a full participant after being limited on Wednesday due to a hamstring injury. 
Two other players were limited on Thursday after being limited on Wednesday as well: safety George Iloka, who didn't play against Kansas City due to an ankle injury, and running back Jeremy Hill (knee).
